text: Brock Island is one of the uninhabited islands of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago located in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Located at 77°51'N 114°27'W, it measures in size and lies close to Mackenzie King Island. The first known sighting of the island by a European was by Vilhjalmur Stefansson in 1915 and it was later named for Reginald W. Brock, Dean of Applied Science at the University of British Columbia. ==References== Terra MODIS satellite image of Brock Island (left) and Mackenzie King Island (centre). ==External links== *Brock Island in the Atlas of Canada - Toporama; Natural Resources Canada Category:Islands of the Queen Elizabeth Islands Category:Uninhabited islands of the Northwest Territories Category:Islands of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago
title: Brock Island
